body:
If you're making a package for helpers, might as well do the full set of
helpers we have in the standard library:

func Get(url string) (resp *Response, err error)
func Head(url string) (resp *Response, err error)
func Post(url string, bodyType string, body io.Reader) (resp *Response, err
error)
func PostForm(url string, data url.Values) (resp *Response, err error)


On 28 July 2015 at 15:56, Brad Fitzpatrick <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> So, I guess just a function like Do(httpClient, ctx, req) then?
>
> Making a request just for GET is annoying, so probably also GET.
>
> I don't think a RoundTripper works, it goes against the intent of the
> context package by putting a Context into a struct.
>
> Be sure to also file a bug against Google's internal codebase to make sure
> all our various RoundTrippers support the new Cancel field.
